review: i think the Chromcast at this point in time is still a bit too overrated. maybe if you have an ideal setup ie. ipad + apple tv + tv things will work out ideally for you. if you have a iphone/PC + TV. but outside of those usual suspects, you're on your own in no man's land.so far there's still no way to stream movies from an HTPC through your phone/tablet to a TV that's in a remote room. you're only left with the default options of Netflix and a handful of apps that work with Chromecast through your tablet and phone. if you want to stream movies from your HTPC using VLC streamer and upstream those movies in real-time to your TV in a different room that's plugged in with a chromecast, you're out of luck. with an apple TV you could accomplish this, but with a price. alas a used apple tv can be had for around $50 nowadays.hopefully google will open up its codes to developers so more apps can work with the chromecast. but at this point in time, be prepared, the usage will be very limited.
